Hi,

We're having trouble with JUnit 4 which appears to be due to a small
=
change that was made in to BaseTestRunner.  The problem is a
ClassCastExcep=
tion in BaseTestRunner when loading our suite class.  In
JUnit 3, it didn't=
 matter what type of class was loaded as long as it
had a static suite() me=
thod with no arguments.  But now in JUnit 4,
the class must extend TestCase=
.  I don't understand why this is
necessary - the getTest() method returns =
the Test interface and
internally it still uses reflection to get the stati=
c suite() method.
 So why does the code cast the Class to a TestCase?  It s=
eems like
this is a case of overzealous use of the new parameterized types =
in
Java 5 and a regression from JUnit 3.

Also, in JUnit 3 the method loadS=
uiteClass() called getLoader() to get
the ClassLoader to use, which opened =
the door for extensibility.  This
is gone now, why?

Thanks in advance...
